item.title: Quoting John Gruber
item.description:
I really dislike the practice of replacing passwords with email â€œmagic linksâ€. Autofilling a password from my keychain happens instantly; getting a magic link from email can take minutes sometimes, and even in the fastest case, itâ€™s nowhere near instantaneous. Replacing something very fastâ€‰â€”â€‰password autofillâ€‰â€”â€‰with something slower is just a terrible idea. â€” John Gruber

item.title: Quoting D. Richard Hipp
item.description:
I'm of the opinion that you should never use mmap, because if you get an I/O error of some kind, the OS raises a signal, which SQLite is unable to catch, and so the process dies. When you are not using mmap, SQLite gets back an error code from an I/O error and is able to take remedial action, or at least compose an error message. â€” D. Richard Hipp
Tags: d-richard-hipp, sqlite

files-to-prompt 0.4 New release of my files-to-prompt tool adding an option for filtering just for files with a specific extension. item.title: Grant Negotiation and Authorization Protocol (GNAP)
item.description: Grant Negotiation and Authorization Protocol (GNAP) RFC 9635 was published a few days ago. GNAP is effectively OAuth 3 - it's a newly standardized design for a protocol for delegating authorization so an application can access data on your behalf.
